\chapter{Installation Guide}
\label{\detokenize{index:installation-guide}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To get started with the project, follow these steps:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Clone the Repository}: If you haven’t already, clone the repository using Git.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/imanzaf/ift\PYGZus{}coursework\PYGZus{}2024.git
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Install Python and Poetry}:
\sphinxhyphen{} Ensure you have Python installed. You can download it from \sphinxhref{https://www.python.org/downloads/}{python.org}.
\sphinxhyphen{} Install Poetry by following the \sphinxhref{https://python-poetry.org/docs/\#installation}{official Poetry installation guide}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Navigate to the Project Directory}: Move into the cloned repository directory.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nb}{cd}\PYG{+w}{ }team\PYGZus{}dogwood/coursework\PYGZus{}one
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Install Dependencies}: Use Poetry to install the project dependencies.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
poetry\PYG{+w}{ }install
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Set Up Environment Variables}: Create a \sphinxtitleref{.env} file in the root directory and populate it with the required environment variables.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Run the Project}: Use Poetry to run the main script.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
poetry\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }python\PYG{+w}{ }main.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{enumerate}


\chapter{Project Structure}
\label{\detokenize{index:project-structure}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The project is organized into the following modules:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{\textasciigrave{}config\textasciigrave{}}: Contains configuration settings for the project.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{\textasciigrave{}src\textasciigrave{}}: Contains the main source code, including data models, database interactions, and utility functions.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For more details, refer to the {\hyperref[\detokenize{modules:modules}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std}{\DUrole{std-ref}{src}}}}} section.

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Data Models}: Defines the structure and validation rules for data entities.

\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {}

\subsubsection{Data Models Package}
\label{\detokenize{src.data_models:data-models-package}}\label{\detokenize{src.data_models::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This package contains the data models used in the project. These models define the structure of the data
and provide validation using Pydantic. The models are designed to represent entities such as companies,
ESG reports, and other related data.
\subsubsection*{\sphinxstylestrong{Key Features}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Define the structure of data using Pydantic models.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Validate data inputs to ensure consistency and correctness.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Support for nested models and relationships between entities.

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Data Models Module}
\label{\detokenize{src.data_models:module-src.data_models.company}}\label{\detokenize{src.data_models:data-models-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!src.data\_models.company@\spxentry{src.data\_models.company}}\index{src.data\_models.company@\spxentry{src.data\_models.company}!module@\spxentry{module}}\subsubsection*{\sphinxstylestrong{Overview}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{company} module contains the \sphinxtitleref{Company} and \sphinxtitleref{ESGReport} classes, which represent companies and their
associated ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) reports. These models are used to validate and
structure data related to companies and their ESG activities.
\subsubsection*{\sphinxstylestrong{Key Features}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Company Class}: Represents a company with attributes such as stock symbol, name, sector, industry,
location, and associated ESG reports.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{ESGReport Class}: Represents an ESG report with attributes such as URL and publication year.

\end{itemize}

\subsubsection{Database Package}
\label{\detokenize{src.database:database-package}}\label{\detokenize{src.database::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This package contains modules for interacting with databases and storage services, including \sphinxstylestrong{PostgreSQL} for relational data and \sphinxstylestrong{MinIO} for object storage.


\paragraph{Database Minio Module}
\label{\detokenize{src.database:module-src.database.minio}}\label{\detokenize{src.database:database-minio-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!src.database.minio@\spxentry{src.database.minio}}\index{src.database.minio@\spxentry{src.database.minio}!module@\spxentry{module}}\subsubsection*{\sphinxstylestrong{Overview}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{minio} module provides functionality for interacting with \sphinxstylestrong{MinIO}, an open\sphinxhyphen{}source object storage service. It includes methods for uploading, downloading, and managing files stored in MinIO buckets.
\subsubsection*{\sphinxstylestrong{Key Features}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Upload files to MinIO buckets.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Download files from MinIO buckets.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Manage bucket policies and configurations.

\end{itemize}
\index{MinioFileSystem (class in src.database.minio)@\spxentry{MinioFileSystem}\spxextra{class in src.database.minio}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{src.database:src.database.minio.MinioFileSystem}}

\paragraph{Database Postgres Module}
\label{\detokenize{src.database:module-src.database.postgres}}\label{\detokenize{src.database:database-postgres-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!src.database.postgres@\spxentry{src.database.postgres}}\index{src.database.postgres@\spxentry{src.database.postgres}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Methods for interacting with postgres database.
\subsubsection*{\sphinxstylestrong{Overview}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{postgres} module provides functionality for interacting with \sphinxstylestrong{PostgreSQL}, a powerful open\sphinxhyphen{}source relational database. It includes methods for querying, inserting, updating, and deleting data in PostgreSQL tables.
\subsubsection*{\sphinxstylestrong{Key Features}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Execute SQL queries.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Insert, update, and delete records.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Manage database connections and transactions.

\end{itemize}
\index{PostgreSQLDB (class in src.database.postgres)@\spxentry{PostgreSQLDB}\spxextra{class in src.database.postgres}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{src.database:src.database.postgres.PostgreSQLDB}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{k}{class}\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{src.database.postgres.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{PostgreSQLDB}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{BaseModel}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Methods for connecting to and interacting with the PostgreSQL database.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class provides methods for connecting to a PostgreSQL database, executing SQL operations,
and managing database sessions. It supports both read and upsert (update/insert) operations.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{BaseModel}} \textendash{} Inherits from Pydantic’s BaseModel for data validation and settings management.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Example}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{db} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{PostgreSQLDB}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k}{with} \PYG{n}{db}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{g+gp}{... }    \PYG{n}{db}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{execute}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{read}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{sql\PYGZus{}statement}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{SELECT * FROM companies}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Inserts a new CSR report record into the database.
If (company\_id, report\_year) is unique, we use ON CONFLICT to avoid duplicates.
Adjust if you have a primary key like ‘report\_id serial primary key’.

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsubsection{Utils Package}
\label{\detokenize{src.utils:utils-package}}\label{\detokenize{src.utils::doc}}\subsubsection*{\sphinxstylestrong{Overview}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This package contains utility modules that provide reusable functionality for data processing, searching, and other common tasks. These modules are designed to simplify development and promote code reuse across the project.
\subsubsection*{\sphinxstylestrong{Key Features}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Data processing and transformation utilities.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Search functionality for querying and filtering data.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Reusable helper functions for common tasks.

\end{itemize}

\label{\detokenize{src.utils:module-src.utils.data}}\label{\detokenize{src.utils:utils-data-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!src.utils.data@\spxentry{src.utils.data}}\index{src.utils.data@\spxentry{src.utils.data}!module@\spxentry{module}}\subsubsection*{\sphinxstylestrong{Overview}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{data} module provides utility functions for processing and transforming data. It includes methods for cleaning, formatting, and manipulating data to ensure consistency and usability.

\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Clean and preprocess raw data.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Transform data into required formats.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Handle missing or inconsistent data.

\end{itemize}
\index{download\_pdf\_from\_urls() (in module src.utils.data)@\spxentry{download\_pdf\_from\_urls()}\spxextra{in module src.utils.data}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{src.utils:src.utils.data.download_pdf_from_urls}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{src.utils.data.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{download\_pdf\_from\_urls}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{urls}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{List\DUrole{p}{{[}}str\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{root\_path}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Downloads PDF files from a list of URLs.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This function attempts to download a PDF file from each URL in the list. It stops
on the first successful download and returns the path to the downloaded file.
If no URLs are successful, it logs an error and returns \sphinxtitleref{None}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{urls}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{List}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} A list of URLs to attempt downloading PDFs from.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{root\_path}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The directory path where the downloaded PDF will be saved.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The path to the downloaded PDF file if successful, otherwise \sphinxtitleref{None}.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Union{[}str, None{]}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Example}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{urls} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}
\PYG{g+gp}{... }    \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{https://example.com/report.pdf}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{g+gp}{... }    \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{https://example.com/report}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{g+gp}{... }\PYG{p}{]}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{root\PYGZus{}path} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{./downloads}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}

\paragraph{Utils Search Module}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{search} module provides utility functions for searching and filtering data. It includes methods for querying datasets and retrieving relevant results based on specific criteria.

\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Query datasets using flexible search parameters.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Filter and sort search results for better usability.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Support for advanced search operations.

\end{itemize}
\index{clean\_company\_name() (in module src.utils.search)@\spxentry{clean\_company\_name()}\spxextra{in module src.utils.search}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{src.utils:src.utils.search.clean_company_name}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{src.utils.search.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{clean\_company\_name}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{name}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}}
{{ $\rightarrow$ str}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Cleans a company name by removing legal suffixes, common articles, and extra spaces.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This function removes common legal suffixes (e.g., “Inc”, “Ltd”, “LLC”) and articles
(e.g., “a”, “the”, “and”) from the company name. It also strips any leading or trailing
whitespace.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The raw company name to clean.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The cleaned company name.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
str

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Example}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{raw\PYGZus{}name} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Apple Inc. and The Company}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{cleaned\PYGZus{}name} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{clean\PYGZus{}company\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{raw\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{cleaned\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{\PYGZdq{}Apple Company\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{config}
\label{\detokenize{config:config}}\label{\detokenize{config::doc}}\subsubsection*{\sphinxstylestrong{Overview}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This section provides an overview of the configuration modules in the project. These modules handle settings and configurations for various components, such as database connections and search functionality.
\subsubsection*{\sphinxstylestrong{Key Features}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Database Settings}: Manages database connection settings and configurations.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Search Settings}: Handles configurations for search\sphinxhyphen{}related functionality.

\end{itemize}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{BaseSettings}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Configuration for database settings, including PostgreSQL and MinIO.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class defines the configuration settings required to connect to a PostgreSQL database
and a MinIO storage service. The settings are loaded from environment variables or a \sphinxtitleref{.env} file.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Variables}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{POSTGRES\_DRIVER}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The driver used to connect to the PostgreSQL database.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{POSTGRES\_USERNAME}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The username for the PostgreSQL database.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{POSTGRES\_PASSWORD}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The password for the PostgreSQL database.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{POSTGRES\_PORT}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The port on which the PostgreSQL database is running.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{POSTGRES\_HOST}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The host address of the PostgreSQL database.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{POSTGRES\_DB\_NAME}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The name of the PostgreSQL database.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{MINIO\_USERNAME}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The username for the MinIO storage service.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{MINIO\_PASSWORD}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The password for the MinIO storage service.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{MINIO\_PORT}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The port on which the MinIO service is running.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{MINIO\_BUCKET\_NAME}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The name of the bucket in MinIO where files are stored.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{BaseSettings}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Configuration for search settings, including Google API and sustainability reports API.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class defines the configuration settings required to interact with the Google Custom Search API
and a sustainability reports API. The settings are loaded from environment variables or a \sphinxtitleref{.env} file.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Variables}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{GOOGLE\_API\_URL}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The base URL for the Google Custom Search API.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{GOOGLE\_API\_KEY}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The API key for the Google Custom Search API.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{GOOGLE\_ENGINE\_ID}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The search engine ID for the Google Custom Search API.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{SUSTAINABILITY\_REPORTS\_API\_URL}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The base URL for the sustainability reports API.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Example}

\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{search\PYGZus{}settings}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{GOOGLE\PYGZus{}API\PYGZus{}URL}\PYG{p}{)}

\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}
